metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29960 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Firefox used to cache the last filename used for printing a file. When generating a filename for printing, Firefox usually suggests the web page title. The caching and suggestion techniques combined may have lead to the title of a website visited during private browsing mode being stored on disk. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 89.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.04.1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
